alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County; Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 17 at 1:16AM PDT until April 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades, Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades, Klamath Basin and Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County. In The Cascades and northern Klamath county, this includes Chemult, Diamond Lake, and the Crater Lake area. This includes highways 140, 97, 62, 138, and 230. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County; Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
